title: 2025 will be a decisive year for the climate in a world 'more uncertain and tense than ever'
summary: 2024 is on track to be the hottest year on record, while meteorological disasters are multiplying. Meanwhile, the geopolitical context has become more tense than ever, relegating climate concerns behind wars, austerity, trade conflicts and political instability.

title: Five dead and more than 1,000 structures destroyed in LA wildfires
summary: The LA County Fire Chief said five people were killed and many others injured in the fires, with tens of thousands ordered to evacuate their homes. With an estimated 1,000 structures destroyed and the flames still growing on Wednesday, the Pacific Palisades fire is already said to be the most destructive in LA history.

title: Russian missile attack in Ukraine kills at least 13 civilians
summary: In a campaign of sustained aerial bombardment throughout the nearly three-year conflict, Russia has frequently sustained aerial attacks on civilian population centers across Ukraine, marking one of the war's defining and most devastating tactics.

title: Donald Trump's rhetoric of a new American imperialism
summary: At a press conference in Florida on Tuesday, the president-elect reiterated his territorial ambitions, wanting to gain control of the Panama Canal, Canada and Greenland.

title: 'At what point does hybrid warfare become outright war?'
summary: Alongside its war in Ukraine, Russia is engaging in another form of conflict, increasingly intense, against the rest of Europe. Europeans are lacking a strategy to deal with it, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Award-winning migrant actor granted visa to stay in France
summary: Abou Sangare won a prize at Cannes last year for his portrayal of a migrant seeking to stay in France, and has himself now secured a visa on his fourth attempt – to work as a mechanic.

title: Israeli hostage found dead in Gaza, military
summary: The discovery of the body comes as Israel and Hamas are considering a ceasefire deal that would free the remaining hostages in Gaza and could halt the fighting. Israel has declared that about a third of the remaining 100 hostages have died, but believes as many as half could be dead.

title: UK to sanction Channel people-smugglers in migration crackdown
summary: The journeys – often in overloaded, poorly maintained inflatable vessels that are ill-suited to open seas – began on a large scale in 2018.

title: Denmark outraged following Trump's statements on Greenland
summary: During a press conference, the newly elected President of the United States did not rule out the use of force to seize the autonomous territory. His remarks have sparked strong reactions within the Scandinavian kingdom, a NATO member.

title: Trump asks Supreme Court to block sentencing in hush-money case in New York
summary: Trump's convictions arose from what prosecutors said was an attempt to cover up a $130,000 hush money payment to porn actor Stormy Daniels just before the 2016 presidential election.

title: Costa Rica President Chaves does not like criticism, nor the press
summary: In his weekly televised press conference, Rodrigo Chaves spares no effort in hurling insults at the media and journalists who point out his mistakes.

title: Gunfire inside Chad's presidential palace leaves 19 dead, several injured
summary: The African country has recently ended a military accord with former colonial power France and has faced accusations that it was interfering in the conflict ravaging neighboring Sudan.

title: Yakuza leader pleads guilty to conspiring to sell nuclear material
summary: Prosecutors alleged that 60-years-old Takeshi Ebisawa "brazenly" moved material containing uranium and weapons-grade plutonium, alongside drugs, from Myanmar.

title: How the Paris 2015 attacks changed France's fight against terrorism
summary: With the Charlie Hebdo shooting, January 7, 2015 marked the beginning of a series of terrorist attacks that hit France throughout that year. They profoundly changed the way France fights against terrorism.

title: Musée d'Orsay needs to offer young people 'even more stimulating programming,' says president
summary: Accessibility, immersive projects, loans of works... In an interview with Le Monde, Sylvain Amic details his roadmap for the famous Paris museum.

title: Meta's Zuckerberg follows Musk and Bezos in Big Tech's march behind Trump
summary: Mark Zuckerberg's announcement on Tuesday of changes to the content moderation policy of Facebook and Instagram marks a symbolic U-turn. He says his move is in the name of 'freedom of expression.'

title: Blinken brushes off Trump remarks in farewell to France
summary: Outgoing US Secretary of State Antony Blinken was visiting Paris, where Emmanuel Macron was presenting him with the Légion d'honneur.

title: Freed Italian journalist jailed in Iran lands in Rome
summary: Cecilia Sala, who was arrested in Tehran and jailed for three weeks, has arrived back in Italy, hours after Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's office announced her release.

title: Thousands of pornographic ads go unmoderated on Facebook and Instagram
summary: Published on Wednesday, a report by AI Forensics documents the presence of pornographic advertisements on Meta's social media platforms.

title: The uncertain consequences of Jean-Marie Le Pen's death
summary: The death of the French far right's former leader comes with political questions for his daughter Marine Le Pen. Should his funeral be public? How should she speak of him?

title: Telegram gave more user data to French authorities after founder's arrest
summary: Pavel Durov, the founder and chief executive officer of the messaging app, was arrested in Paris last August over criminal content posted by users on his platform.

title: 'Tariffs imposed on China will not make Europe the Champion of EVs'
summary: In the span of just twenty years, China has managed to create a new automotive landscape, built on technological expertise and electric batteries that make it extremely difficult for Europe to compete with the Chinese, either in the short or medium term, observes Harold Thibault in his column.

title: Orthodox Patriarch Kirill blesses crosses engraved with Putin's initials for Ukraine war 'heroes'
summary: Since the start of his "special military operation" in February 2022, Putin has turned to religion and closed ranks with the head of the Orthodox Church to call out what he sees as the decline of Western morality.

title: In 'The Room Next Door,' Pedro Almodovar captures the depths of friendship at death's doorstep
summary: Spanish filmmaker's first movie shot in the US captures the bond between two women, as one claims her final act.

title: Jewish families hurt by 'indifference and oblivion' to 2015 Paris kosher store attack
summary: Ten years after the hostage crisis attack that left four people dead at the Hyper Cacher supermarket in Paris, and facing a rise in anti-Semitic incidents, the local Jewish community is 'sad and bitter.'

title: Why the controversial bishop of Fréjus-Toulon resigned
summary: After 25 years at the head of the diocese, Dominique Rey was not in Rome's good books, notably for financial mismanagement.

title: Tibet earthquake: 'In the worst-hit villages, 80-90% of houses have collapsed'
summary: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake killed at least 126 people and injured 188 in the south of the autonomous region in China, close to Nepal, on Tuesday morning. Rescue workers are still searching the rubble.

title: 'I lost brothers that morning': Tributes held at former 'Charlie Hebdo' and Hyper Cacher premises
summary: The day of commemoration of the January 7, 2015 attacks took place under heavy security, with spectators being kept at a distance from the various ceremonial sites.

title: From Chad to Senegal, Macron's remarks on 'ingratitude' of African leaders spark backlash
summary: In a speech to French ambassadors, French president Emmanuel Macron claimed that African leaders 'forgot to say thank you' for France's 2013 military intervention in the Sahel, provoking immediate ire from Chad's president.

title: Kamel Daoud: 'It's more fruitful to be a traitor than a conformist'
summary: The winner of the Prix Goncourt 2024 talks about the controversy sparked by the award and his support for writer Boualem Sansal, imprisoned in Algeria.

title: French authorities promised to 'combat agribashing.' But attacks on intensive agriculture are scant
summary: Five years after being set up in certain parts of France, with much fanfare, the bodies monitoring this controversial 'ideological' concept have seen little or no activity, according to documents obtained by the ARIA association.

title: Los Angeles engulfed by wildfires: 'Like a war zone in a horror movie'
summary: At least five people have died in the fires raging around Los Angeles and now threatening the Hollywood district, whose residents were briefly ordered to evacuate.

title: French minister to Musk and Zuckerberg: 'Stop instrumentalizing freedom of speech'
summary: In an interview, French Junior Minister for Artificial Intelligence and Digital Technologies Clara Chappaz reacts to the accusations of 'censoring' leveled by the owner of X and the founder of Meta against EU laws.

title: 'Turkey and Israel begin 2025 in a position of strength in the Middle East'
summary: While in Syria, Turkey is taking the place of Russia and the Islamic Republic of Iran, while the latter, along with Hamas and Hezbollah, is registering defeat after defeat at the hands of Israel, writes Le Monde's columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Army chief Joseph Aoun elected as Lebanese president
summary: Aoun received 99 out of 128 votes in Parliament after failing to get the required majority in the first round earlier in the day.

title: 'Not a cent' of Libyan money spent on political campaigns, Sarkozy tells French court
summary: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy was defiant in court on Thursday as he denied charges of illegal campaign financing against him.

title: Christian Lacroix becomes Spanish
summary: The ready-to-wear brand, founded in France in 1987 was acquired by Sociedad Textil Lonia from American Falic.

title: Immigration takes center stage in Germany's election campaign
summary: The attack in Magdeburg on December 20 has pushed the issue of immigration to the top of the agenda for all German political parties, not just the far-right AfD, in the run-up to the February 23 parliamentary elections.

title: Los Angeles fires: In Hollywood, evacuation orders lifted for most affected areas
summary: After Pacific Palisades, the San Fernando Valley and Altadena, a new fire broke out on Wednesday evening in the Hollywood Hills, a few hundred meters from the famous Walk of Fame. At least five people died as a result of these winter fires fueled by strong winds.

title: New York's highest appeals court declines to block Trump's sentencing in hush money case
summary: This leaves the US Supreme Court as the president-elect's likely last option to prevent the hearing from taking place on Friday.

title: Former US president Jimmy Carter honored with state funeral
summary: All five living US presidents gathered in Washington for Carter's state funeral. President Joe Biden will deliver the eulogy.
